I would recommend "The Wraith" and "Elizabeth". Both movies have a similar storyline where a mysterious man descends from the sky and manifests in a sports car and targets a local violent road- racing gang of motor heads, headed by a ruthless bully who'ld do anything to get what he wants. The difference between the two movies is the characters and their relationships. In "The Wraith", the main character is a mysterious man that descends from the sky and manifests in a sports car and targets a local violent road- racing gang of motor heads, headed by a ruthless bully who'ld do anything to get what he wants. The main character in "Elizabeth" is Elizabeth I, the queen of England from 1558 until her death on March 28, 1603. Elizabeth was born in London on September 7, 1536. She was the illegitimate daughter of Mary Tudor and Thomas Seymour.
In "Waiting", the main character is a young woman named Clare who works as an artist in Padua, Italy. Her brother Baptista has recently passed away, leaving his eldest daughter Katherine to take over and run the family business that had been handed down from generation to generation.
